elements.title: EnPowered
elements.description: Canada based EnPowered has a platform that measures Rates, capacity or demand charges, delivery fees - market spikes drive up costs in energy bills, making forecasts to plan usage and avoid costly events.

elements.title: Solar pro tool
elements.description: Austrian software for solar panel design with 3D

elements.title: Smap Energy
elements.description: SMAP Energy originated from research at the University of Cambridge. In collaboration with our academic and industrial partners, we’ve developed novel machine learning and AI techniques and products that take advantage of growing smart meter data reserves. [Acquired by Japanese firm ENECHANGE](https://www.current-news.co.uk/news/smart-meter-data-firm-smap-energy-snapped-up-by-enechange) in March 2021

elements.title: Argand solutions
elements.description: Devon based Argand enable renewables and / or energy storage to connect to the Grid and these assets to then perform optimally through better data and analysis. [GridMAP](https://www.argandsolutions.com/gridmap-optimum-energy-storage-modelling) provides pre & post-project modelling and optimisation analysis for solar PV, wind, CHP and energy storage systems.

elements.title: Arenko
elements.description: Optimisation of technical and commercial performance of flexible assets in real time. Arenko underwent a significant transformation in July 2020, selling its only battery storage asset and transitioning into the software sector entirely. from [Current News](https://www.current-news.co.uk/blogs/a-pure-play-software-company-arenkos-rupert-newland-on-flexibility-and-the-new-battery-markets)

elements.title: Levelise
elements.description: Oxford based Levelise developed a home energy management system that links domestic battery systems to a suite of algorithmic controls

elements.title: Net2grid
elements.description: mobile app for energy consumption insights and efficiency. Finalists of free electrons 2020

elements.title: ABSolar
elements.description: Absolar is a University of Southampton spin out. Has implemented a software platform that makes an assessment of solar radiation and PV potential for the built environment

elements.title: Ohm Connect
elements.description: OhmHours are energy saving events, usually an hour in length, in which OhmConnect has committed to the grid that our users (you!) will save energy. From [CNBC](https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/07/alphabet-backed-sidewalk-bets-on-getting-customers-to-cut-energy-use-.html): received $100 million from Alphabet-backed [Sidewalk Infrastructure Partners](https://sidewalkinfra.com/) to build the largest distributed clean power plant in North America. SIP invested $20 million in OhmConnect directly, with the additional $80 million going towards building a virtual power plant

elements.title: Real-time Operational Smartgrid for Europe - ROSE
elements.description: Nata nel 2014, nell’ambito dell’Associazione Genova Smart City, ROSE (Real-time Operational Smartgrid for Europe) è utilizzata nella Smart Polygeneration Microgrid del Campus di Savona dell’Università di Genova, scelto da Enel come Living Lab.

elements.title: Enian
elements.description: ENIAN is on a mission to fix our broken energy system with data and software. Their platform is an enterprise SaaS solution that provides all of the management tools for renewable energy professionals.

elements.title: Prosume - formerly Dajie
elements.description: Blockchain powered Carbon credits produced by solar and consumed in micro-grid,  Dajie

elements.title: Positive Energy
elements.description: Singapore based, European founders. Positive Energy's mission is to accelerate the deployment of renewable energy assets globally with a platform that digitizes the asset finance workflow creating greater efficiency in business processes, operations, transparency and security resulting in higher profitability and performance.

elements.title: IES - Intelligent Communities Lifecycle (ICL)
elements.description: Intelligent Communities Lifecycle (ICL)  is a digital twin & simulation software to assess energy consumption and optimisation for aggregation of buildings in communities, developed by Integrated Environmental Solutions (IES)

elements.title: Dreev
elements.description: V2G platform. Dreev solution relies on Nuvve technology that has already been deployed and validated on 5 continents. Dreev is a creation of both San Diego based [Nuvve](https://nuvve.com/) and EDF Pulse Expansion.

elements.title: EV energy
elements.description: Our smart platform manages EV charging, automatically optimizing for a greener, cheaper charge.

elements.title: Bee Bryte
elements.description: software-as-a-service minimizing utility bills with automatic control of heating-cooling equipment (e.g. HVAC), pumps, EV charging points and/or batteries

elements.title: Station A
elements.description: Instead of providing bits and pieces of data and functionality, we are reimagining how clean energy projects are evaluated and developed from origination to operation.

elements.title: Cortex
elements.description: Cortex is built to dramatically improve how buildings operate by applying software and analytics to highly underutilized data streams. By building the software and analytics layer overtop these disparate data streams, we can fundamentally improve the sustainability of commercial buildings, the value of those assets, and the experience of occupants inside them.

elements.title: StorageVET and DER-VET
elements.description: The Electric Power Research Institute [EPRI](https://www.epri.com/about) conducts research, development, and demonstration projects for the benefit of the public in the United States and internationally. StorageVET 2.1 facilitates the understanding of where to place and install energy storage, the optimum size as well as controls options. [DER-VET™](https://www.der-vet.com/) is a publicly available, open-source, optimization-based energy valuation and planning tool for distributed energy resources (DER) and larger, centralized energy resources

elements.title: Energy Storage Computational Tool (ESCT)
elements.description: The Energy Storage Computational Tool (ESCT) is a Microsoft Excel based application that was funded by DOE Office of Electricity Delivery and Energy Reliability (OE) and developed by Navigant Consulting.

elements.title: Electron
elements.description: Electron London based, presented at Mission Innovation workshop

elements.title: Echoin from Powerlinks

elements.description: Vlux is the blockchain that powers Verv (see section above)

elements.title: Energy Web
elements.description: Energy Web open-source, scalable blockchain platform specifically designed for the energy sector’s regulatory, operational, and market needs. elements.description: EnergiMine blockchain that focuses on making energy procurement smarter, improving efficiency, cost effectiveness and ultimately, mitigating the effects of climate change. In the news [11.6.19](https://theenergyst.com/energi-mine-plans-global-peer-to-peer-energy-exchange/)

elements.description: PVGIS has been developed for more than 10 years at the European Commission Joint Research Centre, at the JRC site in Ispra, Italy. The focus of PVGIS is research in solar resource assessment, photovoltaic (PV) performance studies, and the dissemination of knowledge and data about solar radiation and PV performance.

elements.description: Sighten Platform for solar workflow management, from planning, financing, installation, monitoring, support

elements.description: The System Advisor Model (SAM)  is a free techno-economic software model that facilitates decision-making for people in the renewable energy industry. They want to change the way that people use energy by putting data-driven, intelligent control into the hands of commercial energy consumers. Has [raised 2.5M in Oct 19](https://www.bp.com/en/global/corporate/news-and-insights/press-releases/bp-expands-its-digital-energy-portfolio-by-investing-in-energy-management-platform-grid-edge.html) from BP Ventures
